column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#Text=The catalyst composition, given in Table 1 under Example No. 2, was made as follows in the geometrical shape III in FIG. 1:
#Text=EXAMPLE 2

#Text=The coprecipitate for making the active catalyst phase is produced by dissolving 484.8 g Fe(NO.sub.3).sub.3.9H.sub.2 O, 291.0 g Co(NO.sub.3).sub.2.6H.sub.2 O, 1163.2 g Ni(NO.sub.3).sub.2.6H.sub.2 O and 2.5 g KNO.sub.3 in 3.1 liters of water; and, while stirring, at 90.degree.
#Text=C., one first of all adds a solution of 17.4 g Sm.sub.2 O.sub.3 in 106 g of concentrated HNO.sub.3.
#Text=While stirring further, one adds to this solution 601 g highly-dispersed silicic acid (Aerosil 200) and 1202 g of tempered montmorillonite (specific surface according to BET <1 m.sup.2 /g).
#Text=In a separate vessel, at 60.degree.
#Text=C., one prepares a solution of 2118.6 g (NH.sub.4).sub.6 Mo.sub.7 O.sub.24.6H.sub.2 O in 2.7 liters H.sub.2 O; and to it we add 92.2 g of 85% H.sub.3 PO.sub.4 while stirring intensively.
#Text=After that, the two solutions are combined amid intensive stirring and one adds a solution of 242.5 g Bi(NO.sub.3).sub.3.5H.sub.2 O in 204 g of 8.2% HNO.sub.3.
#Text=The suspension thus obtained is dried in a sprayed drier at a drying air entry temperature of 550.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=The ratio between drying air volume and sprayed suspension quantity is adjusted here so that one gets an exit temperature of 170.degree.
#Text=C. and the suspension quantity is adjusted so that one gets the duration of 6 seconds spent by the spray dried powder in the spray drier.
#Text=The atomization intensity is selected so that one gets a spray dried powder with an average diameter of dp=25 .mu.m.
#Text=The spray dried powder is calcined for 30 minutes in a rotary cylindrical kiln at a maximum temperature of the spray dried powder of 420.degree.
#Text=C.

#Text=1.6 kg of the calcined spray dried powder is arranged in a kneader/extruder combination and is mixed with 0.4 kg pentaerythritol, having an average particle diameter of dp=40 .mu.m ("very finely ground"), for a period of 5 minutes.
#Text=To this mixture one adds 493 g of a 6 weight % tylose solution in which 26.6 g petroleum had first been emulsified.
#Text=This mass is now kneaded until a homogeneous plastic state has been attained.
#Text=Extrusion then takes place at a pressure of 10 bar and a temperature of 30.degree.
#Text=C. in the extruded mass.

#Text=The extruded hollow strand is cut off after every 5 mm, the rings that are cut off (having a diameter of 5 mm, a length of 5 mm and an inside diameter of 1.8 mm) are carefully dried at 80.degree.
#Text=C.
